title: How to Prepare Tomato Dal

steps.headline: Wash the red gram.
steps.description: Put it into the pressure cooker. Add the water to the cooker.

steps.headline: Add the onions, chilis, tomatoes, and coriander.
Add 1 teaspoon of red chili powder and 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric.
Place a quarter of a cup of tamarind in a small bowl that can fit into the cooker.
steps.description: Wash it and fill it with 1/2 cup of water. Carefully place it in the cooker. Put the lid on and push in the pin for the whistle.

steps.headline: After 3 whistles, put the cooker over a low flame to simmer.
steps.description: After 3-4 minutes, take it off the stove. Wait until the pressure decreases.

steps.headline: Open the lid.
steps.description: Drain off any excess water if present in the cooker and tip it into a tumbler for use shortly.

steps.headline: Mash the dal, along with the tamarind.
steps.description: Before mashing, add a sufficient amount of salt, then pour back in the water that you drained out earlier into the tumbler.

steps.headline: Add the flavor to the dal.
steps.description: Pour 3 tablespoons of oil into a pan and heat it. Add 7 garlic cloves, 1 teaspoon of mustard seeds, 1 teaspoon of jeera, 3 red chilies and some curry leaves. Pour the entire contents into the dal and mix it all together.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: The delicious dal is now ready.

text: Wash the red gram. Put it into the pressure cooker. Add the water to the cooker. Add the onions, chilis, tomatoes, and coriander.  Add 1 teaspoon of red chili powder and 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric.  Place a quarter of a cup of tamarind in a small bowl that can fit into the cooker. Wash it and fill it with 1/2 cup of water. Carefully place it in the cooker. Put the lid on and push in the pin for the whistle. After 3 whistles, put the cooker over a low flame to simmer. After 3-4 minutes, take it off the stove. Wait until the pressure decreases. Open the lid. Drain off any excess water if present in the cooker and tip it into a tumbler for use shortly. Mash the dal, along with the tamarind. Before mashing, add a sufficient amount of salt, then pour back in the water that you drained out earlier into the tumbler. Add the flavor to the dal. Pour 3 tablespoons of oil into a pan and heat it. Add 7 garlic cloves, 1 teaspoon of mustard seeds, 1 teaspoon of jeera, 3 red chilies and some curry leaves. Pour the entire contents into the dal and mix it all together. Serve. The delicious dal is now ready.
